page.title: 16Games, Hobbies and Pastimes.
page.content:
Ferreting. As the rabbit population becomes more and more immune to myxomatosis the need for controlling their numbers has increased. Ferrets are being used locally to drive the rabbits from their burrows. In rural communities the practise has always continued but local ferret keepers report an increase in demand for their services.
Beekeeping. In Moreton Morrell, John Taylor has been keeping bees for many years. He is often called out by the Police to collect swarms of bees that are creating a nuisance.
Shooting contiues to be popular especially with the younger men. They shoot rabbits, crows and pigeons of which the farmers are glad to be rid. Clay pigeon shooting is also popular.
